text: Talk to Aventurine

title: Mission Description
content: You have witnessed the truth that can "result in the collapse ofPenacony" as mentioned by Aventurine...Robin's body starts to disintegrate from the crack in her chest and is eventually reduced to nothingness in the dream.Aventurine seems to have something to say. Let's see what he has got up his sleeves.

text: (Talk to Aventurine)

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Ah, friend. My expression wasn't much better than yours when I first saw this.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Your eyes aren't deceiving you — it's her, the famous singer Robin.

text: But... how is that possible?
Could Robin actually...

speaker: Aventurine
line: First of all, can I just say that this had nothing to do with me. I'm just an unlucky bystander here. The Family can testify for me. If you don't believe me, just ask anyone in the Bloodhound Family — they hate me, and they hate the IPC , so they'd never lie.

speaker: Aventurine
line: This is not where the crime happened. What I showed to you was a "memory" — the most basic Light Cone manifesting tech, authorized by the Garden of Recollection and owned by the IPC.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Did you really think the Galaxy Ranger was an outsider this whole time?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Penacony has made a solemn commitment to protect the safety of anyone inside a Family dream. Any person in distress will be forcibly awakened and safely returned to reality.

speaker: Aventurine
line: What gives them the confidence to make such conclusive statements? Because behind this promise is the Harmony : The Family's Dreamweavers link up their minds together to construct an unbreakable defensive line.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Breaking through this line of defense to create "Death" in the dreamscape... Not even a Memokeeper could do that without The Family's permission.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Who could have done it? Friend, the only one is her, the girl who calls herself a Galaxy Ranger... An imposter, an unsought guest, an Emanator who hides her true identity...

speaker: Aventurine
line: Ifrit's death was a foregone conclusion, and Robin... her misfortune was staring right at her. Who will be the next to die?

text: This really is... hard to take in.
That's just one side of the story.
If that's the case, I can't trust anyone.

speaker: Aventurine
line: It's fine. Listen to your gut. Building trust always takes time, and I'm willing to wait.

speaker: Aventurine
line: I just hope you realize that wherever that legacy is concerned... covert plans are already underway throughout Penacony. Everyone's got their own agenda.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Careful you don't get stuck on the wrong side. If I were you, I'd keep my distance from Acheron. After all, any schemes out in the open are always going to be better than a monster in the shadows... right?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Who's to say there isn't an even deeper conspiracy lurking beneath the surface?

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Memokeeper, I think our little deal is finished.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Aventurine is telling the truth. This "memory" is a real one, and there's no sign of any distortion grafting on.

speaker: Aventurine
line: The IPC is not the Garden, and there are real limits to what they can actually do. But you know all this.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Friend, let's not beat around the bush here — the thing is, I want to reach out personally to team up with the Astral Express.

speaker: Aventurine
line: I told you, I'm just not interested in scrambling for "the Legacy." I just came to Penacony for work. I'm here to retrieve some lost property for the IPC, if you catch my drift... I'm talking ownership of this "frontier prison."

speaker: Aventurine
line: This has all become a bad debt thanks to the Cancer of All Worlds . The IPC has tried sitting down for negotiations time and again, but The Family wouldn't even take our calls.

speaker: Aventurine
line: You have no idea how difficult these people are to deal with. Put it this way — they've hushed up the existence of "Death" before, so they can definitely cover up any news about Robin's death.

speaker: Aventurine
line: It'll just quietly float off like a bubble and pop, nobody ever being the wiser...

speaker: Aventurine
line: That's not fair, right? So then, friend, I need your help.

text: What kind of help?
I've got something on right now.

children.speaker: Aventurine
children.line: That's fine. I'm not forcing you.

children.speaker: Aventurine
children.line: But I'm really not asking for much, so why don't you at least hear me out, okay?

text: I can't trust you.

children.speaker: Aventurine
children.line: That's fine. I'm not forcing you.

children.speaker: Aventurine
children.line: But I'm really not asking for much, so why don't you at least hear me out, okay?

speaker: Aventurine
line: I have but only one goal: The Family's front door is like a high wall, and to tear the whole thing down I'll have to dig out a few chunks first. Once I find a weak point, the IPC will have plenty of means.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Now we have our chance. So long as we can get to the truth behind her death , we can have justice for Robin while also gaining a valuable bargaining chip for bringing The Family to the table.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Truly a once-in-a-blue-moon opportunity... I've been investigating and making lots of friends all over Penacony precisely for this very moment.

speaker: Aventurine
line: This tragic news would be extremely bad for The Family, so they'll be doing everything they can to stop it leaking — especially to the IPC.

speaker: Aventurine
line: But I trust there are still a few factions that remain exceptions, and that's why I need you all. The reputation of the Astral Express precedes you, and the Harmony will give you the fairest of appraisals.

speaker: Aventurine
line: You get to find out really what happened and seek justice, and I get to put it toward completing my mission for the IPC... It's what you call a win-win situation.

text: You want to take advantage of The Family's trust in us?
The Nameless would never associate with the IPC.
A decision like this is way above my pay grade...

speaker: Aventurine
line: Don't worry. Just head back and talk things over with your companions.

speaker: Aventurine
line: That navigator is really smart. She must understand the value of this deal. Look, here's my contact details. If you come to any conclusions, call me.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Oh, and... take this! A thorough investigation can always use a little more funding. Don't mention it!

speaker: Aventurine
line: So long, friend. I really am looking forward to uncovering the truth about "Death" with everyone.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Aventurine just sauntered off... He really doesn't mean to force it, but something still seems off...)

speaker: Black Swan
line: ...What now? What are your plans?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Black Swan... What is she thinking?)

text: (ObtainCredit×50,000)
Speak with Black Swan

title: Step Description
content: Using Robin's death as an excuse, Aventurine invites you to collaborate with him in bringing down The Family. It is not coercion, but a temptation with the promise of gain. Although he leaves you with enough room to decide, you know that one should not be hasty when it comes to decision-making.You still have the chance to talk to Black Swan and ask for her advice before leaving the Memory Zone.

text: (Talk to Black Swan)

speaker: Black Swan
line: On the surface, this doesn't look like a bad deal for you. But Aventurine is a shrewd merchant whose scheme won't just be as simple as it appears to be.

speaker: Black Swan
line: He doesn't know about Miss Firefly yet — but judging by your reaction, he may have noticed something going on and deliberately shifted topics to the "Truth of Death" to try and pull you in line with his way of thinking.

speaker: Black Swan
line: That's quick thinking, and very sound logic. Aventurine is no fool. And working with him definitely has its dangers.

text: The Nameless cannot turn a blind eye to evil.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: But you're talking about REAL evil.

text: For Firefly's sake, we must get to the bottom of all this.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: That... is something I agree on.

text: Playing it safe seems to be the smarter move.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Insofar as things are presently concerned, yes. But what about the long-term?

text: Can I toss a die to let it decide for me?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Leaving it up to fate? It's just how that gambler thinks.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Anyway, be careful out there. There's more than one way to blaze a trail. In a dark forest beset by wolves ensuring your own escape to safety should be your primary concern.

speaker: Black Swan
line: As for the other questions...

text: Did "Death" kill Robin?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: I'm not sure the two cases were committed by the same culprit, but that massive wound... looked like its winged blade. We've all witnessed it in action before.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Plus... it seems unlikely that there would be two lethal entities loose in the dreamscape.

text: Do you think this is connected to Acheron?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Sorry, I can't answer that question. That ranger is shrouded in mystery. I'm afraid no one is capable of providing an answer.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: But without a doubt... she is the most "special" guest at this banquet. It's like Aventurine said just then. It's best to keep your distance from her.

text: Have you noticed anything else unusual?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Two victims appearing one after the other in a very short time span... In and of itself, that's very unusual.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Two possibilities: The collapse of Penacony's Dreamscape has started speeding up, making "Death" extremely agitated and weakening The Family's protections. Or, everything has been planned out and executed by someone.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: If someone has chosen these victims deliberately... First a stowaway , then a Family celebrity ... Then this murderer's motives are worth thoroughly chewing over.

text: I don't have any other questions.

speaker: Black Swan
line: It's all happened so quickly I can only make conjecture. After leaving here, go have a chat with your companions. I hope you can clarify the source of this confusion.

text: Black Swan leads you through the chaotic Dreamscape...
Follow Black Swan out of the hotel

title: Step Description
content: Black Swan answers your questions and promises to escort you to the exit of the Memory Zone. Hopefully, she isn't up to any mischief this time... Or, do you secretly enjoy the little tricks she pulls?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Come, this way — it's a short walk. Don't get lost.

text: (Approach Black Swan)

speaker: Black Swan
line: This way... This is where we part ways. All of this is like... a nightmare.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Unfortunately, the Remembrance doesn't lie... What we just saw is the "reality" that happened — and it won't fade from our minds just because we wake up.

speaker: Black Swan
line: But follow your heart and don't be afraid. We all walk through this world casting shadows of different lengths, and ultimately... all we leave behind are precious memories.

speaker: Black Swan
line: ...Ah, hold on just a sec.

text: Black Swan gently touches the root of your ear, leaving a cool sensation. Then, she hands a card over to you.

speaker: Black Swan
line: There you go, a small parting gift. If one day, you unfortunately fall into the deep waters of the Memory Zone and there's no Memokeeper to join you — hopefully it can guide you on my behalf.

speaker: Black Swan
line: I also pay great attention to the ways of the world... Just think of this as an apology from me for hiding something from you.

text: Thank you.
That's it?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Then... I've something private to take care of regarding that Galaxy Ranger. Let's leave things there, shall we?

speaker: Black Swan
line: What fascinating memories will you bring for me next time we meet...? I sincerely look forward to them.

text: Messages The Astral Express Family March 7th (Trailblazer) You still at hotel in the dreamscape? (Trailblazer) (Trailblazer) Welt Have you run into trouble? Himeko We got separated in the Memory Zone, but (Trailblazer) is with the Memokeeper March 7th I feel so antsy Help Himeko March, stay calm Dan Heng Do I need to get off the Express and help? Himeko Not at the moment Dan Heng Sure. Just let me know if you need me Welt The Reverie Hotel in the real world is very calm. Not much is happening. — Message History — I'm done. (Trailblazer) I finished investigating on my side. Where should we meet? Where are you? (Trailblazer) I finished investigating on my side. Where should I go to meet you? March 7th (Trailblazer)! Himeko (Trailblazer), it's great that you're safe. March 7th That lady didn't do anything bad, did she? Himeko I'm sorry... about what happened to Firefly. The scene has been cordoned off by The Family. We're wrapping up negotiations with some Family delegates. Let's meet somewhere near the Clockie Statue later.
(ObtainFate's Epistle)
Wait for the Express Crew near the Clockie Statue

title: Step Description
content: Safe and sound, you return to the Golden Hour with a repertoire of information. If everything goes as planned, the Crew will surely be blown away after hearing your experiences... provided that you don't get tongue-tied.Let's look forward to it.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (A Family rep... Is Himeko okay...)

text: (Approach Clockie Statue)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (So much has happened... I should take a moment to gather my thoughts, and wait for everyone to arrive...)

text: Watch the memory

title: Step Description
content: Aren't you curious about what took place on the other side of Penacony while you were waiting for the Crew? Now you have a chance to see it — This can't be explained by science, so just enjoy it.

text: Some time ago — Deep in Memory Zone
(Cutsceneplays)

children.speaker: Sam
children.line: Better unsheathe that blade now.

children.speaker: Sam
children.line: Ranger.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: ...Do you still dream, hunter

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: of those slain by your hand?

text: (Cutscene ends)
Days ago — Ever-Flame Mansion
Media:Trailblaze Mission The Devil in Velvet.mp4

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: ...It appears the outcome has already been determined.

speaker: Acheron
line: They're still alive, as are you.

speaker: Acheron
line: You still have room to make a choice. Leave the music box behind, and then go.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Choice? The bloody trail of the Destruction leaves no room for hesitation.

speaker: Acheron
line: Fetora's fire demon... Even if you sacrifice your life for that Aeon , you won't get special treatment.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Ranger, you tread the narrow Path of The Hunt . You could never understand.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: We come from the fire, and are born bathed in fire. We spread, burn, and destroy until all the kindling has burned out, and we leave only ashes on the ground.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Burning forms the entire life of a fire demon, from the beginning to the end. We are born to die, just to put into practice a profile of another universal truth: All things are created for the Destruction.

speaker: Acheron
line: Your companions don't seem to think so. They fight for your chance at survival.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: They are my children and, just as I was, they are flames that have yet to burn white-hot. They're still young and I don't blame them.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: But my flames are faint and time is running out. Can you see the Planet of Festivities in the distance? I plan to bring purgatory with me there — and before that, I must surpass you.

speaker: Acheron
line: Why?

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Because on the path THEY have forged, you have traveled farther than I have...

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: ..." Emanator ."

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: You cannot hide your true identity. Draw that sword, for we shall indeed remain here, bound to fight a decisive battle to the death, for I choose this.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Destruction is intense but brief. To cravenly cling to life is to endure an endlessly prolonged existence.

speaker: Acheron
line: Even if the answer... turns out to be your own destruction?

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: What's important is not the answer, but that it exists — just as you exist. Everything exists to be destroyed — Emanators are no different.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: Just as even sweet dreams may be born of the void, the so-called impossible is merely something that has yet to happen.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...Alright. I accept.

speaker: Duke Inferno
line: You shall witness the most brilliant and intense fire in existence. May this flame illuminate the farthest reaches of your bottomless dream.

speaker: Acheron
line: A bottomless dream... Yes, that's right. But you've made one small mistake.

speaker: Acheron
line: This blade remains in its scabbard not out of pity or scorn. It's a personal secret that I don't want to disclose, but perhaps out of reciprocity...

text: She says this as her hand gently rests on the hilt of the sword.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...I'll reveal the truth to you.

speaker: Acheron
line: The Hunt... is not the path I truly follow.

speaker: Acheron
line: May death be the end of your boundless dream...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...guiding you back to the waking world.

text: (Cutsceneplays)

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: ...I still see them in my dreams.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Hold it. Your time hasn't come yet.

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Sam
line: ..."My time"?

speaker: Acheron
line: I've seen many clever disguises that can conceal appearances, but they can never cover up who a person really is. And you're no different.

speaker: Acheron
line: ▶ You had no desire to kill (Trailblazer). You only did what you did to drive me and the Memokeeper away... but why?

speaker: Acheron
line: Did Destiny's Slave make you do it?

speaker: Sam
line: You know Elio .

speaker: Acheron
line: I thought this is just the kind of thing that'd get written into your "script."

speaker: Sam
line: My "script" has always been brief. Other than that. Anything beyond that is unnecessary.

speaker: Sam
line: He knows my nature: There is but a single destiny, from which no one can escape... And until then, I hold the privilege of choice.

speaker: Sam
line: However, you appear to be ignorant of this, so it's time for me to inquire: Who exactly are you?

speaker: Acheron
line: Not your enemy, perhaps.

speaker: Sam
line: That's not what I asked.

speaker: Acheron
line: I don't deserve your curiosity. Loners wandering the cosmos always have their secrets. Take me. I've also been wanted by the IPC, so it's little wonder I know something about the Stellaron Hunters ... that's all.

speaker: Acheron
line: Maybe I can help.

speaker: Sam
line: What reason would you have for doing that?

speaker: Acheron
line: I tend to forget things — which is why, rather than memories, I'm accustomed to using my emotions to capture what I normally wouldn't otherwise. So...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...I know who is inside that cold armor.

speaker: Acheron
line: How about it? Ready to take off that armor and sit down for a talk?

speaker: Sam
line: It's not yet time.

speaker: Sam
line: I don't need help, but I can give you a suggestion that would make things better for you and me.

speaker: Sam
line: If your goal is the Watchmaker 's Legacy, then go look into The Family. Not only are they covering up the existence of "Death," but they're burying the past and the truth about what happens inside the Dreamscape.

speaker: Acheron
line: Already on it.

speaker: Sam
line: ...and the Astral Express is no enemy of yours.

speaker: Acheron
line: I know that... I just never expected to hear you say it.

speaker: Acheron
line: ▶ What's next, then? (Trailblazer)'s been taken by Black Swan. Will you go look for ( him / her ) ?

speaker: Sam
line: No need for that... No harm in mentioning that Elio's only given me one instruction: "Get all of the Astral Express to track down the grand legacy."

speaker: Sam
line: I tried settling this in an easier and more direct way, but as you can see, here I am, confronting you: I failed. Can't ever go against "the script."

speaker: Acheron
line: "The so-called impossible is merely something that has yet to happen"...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...That's it. Before we split, can I ask you one more thing?

speaker: Acheron
line: Is there anything else in your "script" about me? I'd like to know what kind of footnote "I" get to leave in that future foreseen by destiny?

speaker: Sam
line: Unfortunately, not a thing came up.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...I knew it.

speaker: Sam
line: Hang on...

speaker: Sam
line: I don't.

speaker: Acheron
line: Don't what?

speaker: Sam
line: Your first question was: "Do you still have dreams about everyone who died because of you?"

speaker: Sam
line: I don't. Never have.

speaker: Sam
line: I was born without the ability to "dream." I live for this cold harsh reality, for a little light, and to burn... to keep on burning, until I turn to ash.

speaker: Sam
line: So, I really envy you.

speaker: Acheron
line: Is that so...

speaker: Acheron
line: Then you're already living in the waking world.
